page.title: 15Goat-keeping 1:The Deverills
page.content: The goat-keeper began keeping goats in {Longbridge Deverill}in 1972 when she bought a two year old goat called Bella. Bella was a pedigree{British {Toggenburg}and the founder of the {Deverill Pedigree Herd.}The herd was gradually built up and now consists of 4O goats,- 2 billy goats, 2O kids and 18 nanny goats for milking. The goats are milked twice a day and give three to six litres of milk. Their milk is whiter and has a different taste to cows' milk. It has smaller fat globules, and is therefore easier to digest and is popular with people who suffer from allergies, the goat-keeper began to keep goats because she suffered with asthma. The milk is frozen after milking and sold naturally, unpasteurised. The milk is also made into yoghurt and sold.
